item.description:
East Hill Farm is working farm & is nestled at the base of Mt. Monadock, next to a beautiful lake, in southern Troy NH which was considered sacred by the Native American Indians &
is also known for its healing energy.
It has rooms in the Inn, cabins, and rooms over looking the lake at Trails End, which is where we will be staying.

It has an indoor, and outdoor swimming pool, a sauna, and hot tub.

Including in the price
($120 per person, per night, not counting tips) Is (3) homecooked delicious meals, made from the farm, served family style.

We have the entire building at Trails end, reserved just for us!
The rooms are beautiful, with (9) rooms with queen size beds, and (9) with twin beds, and a refrigerator.

We have a common living room to ourselves, with a tv and dvd player.

People can have lunch before they come, or pay extra for lunch there, at noon on Saturday.
The price for the extra lunch is about $12.00 including tax and tip. If you are interested in getting there early for lunch on Saturday, you need to let the inn know

Schedule of Events:

12:00- 1:00 pm- Lunch (optional) $12.00

1:00- 2:00 pm- Meet & Greet In Living Room at Trails End- Settle into rooms, Tour of the Farm

Sat April 25th 2:00

~ Option #1- There will be a trip to hike Mt. Monadnock scheduled on Sat from approx 2pm- 4:30pm- Tony will be leading this expedition, & will be following the easiest trail on the mountain, which is an easy climb.
Will have snacks for top of mountain. If you are interested in this option, please note this on rsvp.

To learn more about Mt. Monadnock, check out the following links.

www.monadnockmountain.com/ - 4k
www.nhstateparks.org/state-parks/alphabetical-order/monadnock-state-park/
- 26k

~ Option #2- For those who do not want to climb the mountain, horseback riding is available for $40 per person for 1/2 hour guided trail ride.
This must be scheduled with inn prior to time of ride.

~Option #3- Activities w/ Tala at the Inn

2:00- 3:00 Free channeling class- Have your pineal and pituitary gland activated for channeling and learn techniques to channel.

3:00- 4:00- Short Walk to the Waterfall

4:00- 4:30- Trip to Store

4:30- 5:30- Free Time/ Happy Hour Social in Dining Room

5:30- 6:30- Dinner

6:30- 8:30- Trails End Living Room
Divinations Games: Rune reading, angel cards, wishing on a star & tea leaf reading
Evening Discussion- Book of questions

8:30- 10:30
~ Pagan/ Spiritual Movie- TBA

10:00- Hot Tubbing/ Free Time

Sunday, April 26th

7:00- 10:00 am- Breakfast
(Please note, you have to be in the dining room by 9am if you want
breakfast! )

10:00- 11:00- Spell Craft- Make money pentacles & learn money correspondences (donation for supplies)

11:00- 12:00 Free time/ Pack-Up

12:00- 1:00 Lunch


PLEASE NOTE:

~You can choose to participate or not participate in the above mentioned schedule

~Kids and families are welcome :)

~ If you do not like the options on the menu, the Inn will cook just about anything to your request...
Vegetarian meals are also available, please let the inn know upon reservation....

~Alcohol policy is BYOB
(Bring your own booze)
We will be making a trip to the store on Sat where you can buy that and anything you need.

~Massages are available, $40 for 30 mins and I believe $60 for $65 minutes ( I think) These must be scheduled ahead of time.


~Upon making your reservation, please let the inn know if you are staying in a room with another person (two twin beds) or if you want a room of your own.

~Dogs ARE allowed,
$10.00 extra, and you MUST let them know, and book a CABIN, rather than a room, as dogs can only stay in the cabins.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

VERY IMPORTANT PLEASE NOTE!!!!

You can still call and put a $25 deposit down for this meet up, however, you should do it as SOON as possible, as they will start booking other people in Trails End rooms after Jan 17th-
As long as there are rooms still available, you can book a reservation for this meet up until
April 23rd.

*ALSO*

This reservation can be canceled up until (3) weeks- 21 days prior to the reservation, though you will only get $10 of the $25 dollars back, as they will take a $15 cancellation fee.

ANYTHING LESS than 21 day cancellation, and you will be charged the total $120 fee.

Their cancellation fees are pretty strict, so please keep this in mind.


You can reserve by calling East Hill Farm at:

(800) 242-6495

For information, call:

(603) 242-6495

You will need to put a credit card deposit down, and if you are unable to do this, you can call and ask them if you can send a check.


To check out the link for East Hill Farm, go to:
www.east-hill-farm.com
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the Living Room At Trails End
item.name: Trip To East Hill Farm
